intro: Diapedium sericeum, commonly known as the silky diapedium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, white to pale green flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it its common name. Diapedium sericeum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
